sentences.english: It/The rain bucketed down all afternoon .
Rain began to pour down from a black and comfortless sky.
sentences.chinese: 瓢泼的雨水开始从漆黑不安的天上落下来。

sentences.english: The football match had to hold off for about half an hour because of a driving rain.
sentences.chinese: 一场瓢泼大雨使足球比赛被迫推迟了半个小时。

sentences.english: The rain's been bucketing down all evening.
sentences.chinese: 瓢泼大雨已下了一整夜。

sentences.english: After I met you, I even stood in daybreak's heavily falling rain to help you.
sentences.chinese: 遇见你，陪伴你，在那瓢泼而至的黎明前的风雨之中。
瓢泼大雨阻碍了我们的旅行。

sentences.english: The pounding rain began in the middle of the night.
sentences.chinese: 半夜时分，下起了瓢泼大雨。

sentences.english: Of late years an abundant shower of curates has fallen upon the North of England.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，副牧师象瓢泼的阵雨落在英格兰北部。

sentences.english: It was raining dogs and cats when he came home, so he looked like a drowned rat.
sentences.chinese: 他回来时正下着瓢泼大雨，所以他看上去像个落汤鸡。

sentences.english: The dirty night is spilled in a gourd ladle, world child bastinado knife enters palace.
sentences.chinese: 在一个瓢泼雨夜，世子杖刀闯入王宫。

sentences.english: WHEN caught in pouring rain without an umbrella, most people pick up their pace.
sentences.chinese: 没带雨伞却遭遇瓢泼大雨，多数人会加快脚步。

sentences.english: The rain commenced pouring violently down.
sentences.chinese: 瓢泼大雨猛烈地下了起来。

definition: a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
fine rain/drizzle/poem by Tang poet Li Shangyin 李商隱|李商隐
